page.title: 11LEISURE IN RODNEY STOKE
page.content: Rodney Stoke is a small, quiet village and most people are satisfied with the evenings entertainment on television. Day trips to Wells or Weston, usually combined with a visit for shopping in the car, are also common. Individual hobbies abound and gardening is popular amongst older people. The younger generation are keener to travel to places with more evening activity, such as 'disco dances' or pubs outside the village. Nevertheless home computers can make a teenager hide away happily in a quiet village and one young man was found to be repairing his motor bike in his bedroom!. The June 'Strawberry Fayre' at Draycott and local Gymkhanas are other attractions for the whole community whilst the Rodney Stoke Inn is popular as the local hostelry with its skittle alley in regular use.
